usefulItems: square baking tin (20 cm), baking paper, wire rack, piping bag, small jars, pastry cutter, oven, refrigerator
title: Cake in a Jar

ingredients.content: 40 g sunflower oil, plus extra for greasing
25 g white chocolate, small pieces or callets
24 tsp Baileys, or other cream liqueur (approx. 80 g)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C and line a square baking tin (20 cm) with baking paper.
Place flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, bicarbonate of soda and salt in mixing bowl then mix <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add milk, water and oil then mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>. Finish mixing by hand with spatula then transfer to prepared baking tin.
Bake for 10 minutes (180°C). Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl. Remove cake from tin and allow to cool on a wire rack. Meanwhile, prepare icing.
Place white chocolate in mixing bowl and grate <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>.

Add cream cheese, icing sugar and vanilla extract then mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>15 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer icing to a piping bag and set aside.

Use a pastry cutter to cut 24 discs (Ø 4 cm) out of the chocolate cake. Place a disc of sponge cake in the bottom of 8 jars (each jar Ø 5 cm, approx. 80 ml capacity) add 1 tsp Baileys or cream liqueur and top with icing. Repeat process twice more, finishing with a layer of icing. Decorate each jar with 2 raspberries, then close jar lid.
Store in fridge until ready to pack for your picnic.
